### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#22555](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/22555) (build: Fix `make apk` for Android w/ non-default SOURCES_PATH in
@laanwj do you have any thoughts about this?

No opinion on whether to bump or to what version, but if it was bumped to 1.74, we could remove the suppression: `Can be removed once upgraded to boost test 1.74 in depends` `race:validation_chainstatemanager_tests`.
Any thoughts on this? If there are no objections, I think it makes sense to move forward with this change

>  If there are no objections, I think it makes sense to move forward with this change\n\nI think this is an awkward bump, and if we are going to update Boost again, it might as well be to the current latest version, which is 1.77.0. As mentioned, that would mean we can drop a suppression, and we'd avoid some build warnings related to unused variables in the process module. We are also early eno
Bumped to 1.77 and removed suppression as suggested above, will sqash once we have ACKs / Concept ACKs
> ... will sqash once we have ACKs / Concept ACKs\n\nThe opposite is preferable though...

> > ... will sqash once we have ACKs / Concept ACKs

> The opposite is preferable though...

Okay, squashed, I generally prefer having a clean history, but that's okay :)
> �[0;32m node1 stderr ERROR: The syscall "fstatfs" (syscall number 138) is not allowed by the syscall sandbox in thread "httpworker.0". Please report.

> > �[0;32m node1 stderr ERROR: The syscall "fstatfs" (syscall number 138) is not allowed by the syscall sandbox in thread "httpworker.0". Please report.\n\nAny suggestions? I'd be happy to revert to 1.76 and work it down until ci is happy?
Either you add it in the right place, like commit fab360aa0027a274681eff3f00ac1972bcfa126c or you wait for #20744 or you pick a different version. Not opinion on what to do.

> Either you add it in the right place, like commit [fab360a](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/fab360aa0027a274681eff3f00ac1972bcfa126c) or you wait for #20744 or you pick a different version. Not opinion on what to do.

If someone would like to provide a diff similar to what Marco mentions, I'll be happy to apply it, but I'm not too familiar with syscall sandboxing

At this point

> Bumped to 1.77 and removed suppression as suggested above, 

You didn't update to account for the Cmake files as [mentioned](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23340#issuecomment-962763343).

> Okay, squashed, I generally prefer having a clean history, but that's okay :)

Pull requests are expected to contain changes that are reviewable / ACKable. Don't push random changes / fix

Looks like the msan issue is still there. Maybe a miscompilation? (Can't reproduce in valgrind so far)\n\nAlso, we should watch out for this change in boost 1.76: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/23551#issuecomment-974292532
